newsitem.title: TRINIDAD AND TOBAGO: Trinidad's new president to be sworn in Wednesday.
newsitem.headline: Trinidad's new president to be sworn in Wednesday.

text.p: Former prime minister Ray Robinson will be sworn in as Trinidad and Tobago's third President at 1 p.m. EST (1800 GMT) on Wednesday, Information Minister Wade Mark said.
Robinson will take the oath of office from Chief Justice Michael De La Bastide at a ceremony to be witnessed by more than 1,000 invited guests at the President's House.
Robinson, a 70-year-old lawyer, succeeds Noor Hassanali, who retired at midnight after serving two five-year terms as president.

The new president, who was prime minister from 1986 to 1991, survived a coup attempt on July 27, 1990 when a group of armed black moslems stormed the Parliament Building, holding him and several government ministers hostage for six days.
He was shot and wounded during the insurrection, in which 24 people were killed, including a member of the military police.
